column4: is there a program available that scans for wireless networks and then allows me to connect directly through the program?
can anyone help me?
thank you mneptok, i'll try network manager again. I used it earlier and it didnt seem to display any wireless networks
although...when i installed it earlier, it said network manager was version 0.6. something
is that normal?
okay i've installed network manager gnome
what do i do now?
i cant find it in the tool bar
im so lost and confused!
i think im going to toss my laptop out the window
why is that?
what did you install?
did you install the gnome part of it also?
aptitude install network-manager-gnome
so do a dpkg -L network-manager-gnome | grep bin and see what you get
so run nm-applet
nm-applet
what do you want to do?
is your wireless card setup correctly?
ok so all you should have to do is click on the icon that popped up and you should see the networks for your wireless
yah well it is probably due to network manager being lame on the startup I bet if you reboot (which isn't the only way to fix this but the easiest way) it will fix your issue
restart
